title: Standings
custom_preconds: When the user is on the Main slide out menu
custom_steps: When the user taps on Standings
custom_expected: Then the Standings page will launch the webview internally within the app, it will not launch externally outside the app

title: Standings Page
custom_preconds:
When the user is on the Main slide out menu
and taps on Standings
custom_steps: When the user views the standings page
custom_expected: Then the it will open by default on the 20xx International League Standings, with the drop-downs for Triple-A and International

title: Standings should be separated
custom_preconds: When the user is on the Main slide out menu
custom_steps: When the user taps on Standings and selects an option from the first drop-down for class
custom_expected:
Then on the standings page's 2nd drop-down for league they see the following options in the drop-down:
- if select Triple-A mode they should see two options in the drop-down (International & Pacific Coast)
- if select Double-A mode they should see three options in the drop-down (Eastern, Southern, and Texas)
- if select Class A Advanced mode they should see three options in the drop-down (California, Carolina, and Florida)
- if select Class A Full Season mode they should see two options in the drop-down (Midwest and South Atlantic)
- if select Class A Short Season mode they should see two options in the drop-down (New York-Penn and Northwest)
- if select Rookie mode they should see two tabs (Pioneer & Appalachian)

title: Should be able to toggle back and forth between leagues without issue
custom_preconds: The user has accessed the "Standings" section from the Navigation Menu
custom_steps:
When the drop-down for the different leagues within each class are selected
Test cycling through the various Standings options: Triple A, Double A, Class A Advanced, Class A Full Season, Class A Short Season and Rookie
custom_expected:
Then the respective views should open
And the app should not crash

title: Ensure loading spinner appears while standings pages are loading
custom_steps: When the user taps on Standings from the Navigation Menu or taps one of the tabs at the top of the standings window
custom_expected: Then the loading spinner will appear while the pages are being loaded

title: Verify standings page updates after being backgrounded
custom_preconds:
Given the user opens the app
And goes to the standings page
custom_steps:
When the user backgrounds the app
And the user opens the app back up
custom_expected: Then the Standings pages will update instantly

title: Text should be clear and legible with proper headings and layout
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps: When the user selects "International" league
custom_expected: Then the user can see the standings text with proper headings and layout

title: Teams are broken up by division: North, South, West
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps: When the user selects "International" league
custom_expected:
Then the Standings page will be shown
And the standings should be broken into North, South and West divisions

title: Intenational League standings should represent the correct teams
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps: When the user selects "International" league
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the correct teams in the International league. 
(See link)  http://web.minorleaguebaseball.com/milb/stats/stats.jsp?t=l_sta&lid=117&sid=milb

title: Correct information should be shown in standings
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps: When the user selects "International" league
custom_expected: Then the standings page should appear and the statistics shown for each team should be: W, L, PCT, GB, L10, STRK

title: Each division will have a division winner - should be notated properly according to key
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps:
When the user selects "International"
And a team has clinched a division
custom_expected: Then the division winner[s] will be designated with symbol that is notated in the key at the bottom of the standings page

title: There will be one 'wild card' winner team - should be notated properly according to key
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps:
When the user selects "International"
And a team has clinched a wild card spot
custom_expected: Then the wild card winner will be designated with symbol that is notated in the key at the bottom of the standings page

title: Division winners (3) and wild card winner (1) will be competing playoff teams
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Triple A
custom_steps:
When the user selects "International"
And the season is in the playoffs
custom_expected: Then Division winners (3) and wild card winner (1) will be competing playoff teams

title: Correct information should be shown in standings
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Rookie
custom_steps: When the "Pioneer" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the standings page should appear and the statistics shown for each team should be: W, L, PCT, GB, L10, STRK

title: Teams are broken up by division within conference: North, South
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Rookie
custom_steps: When the "Pioneer" tab is selected
custom_expected: Then the Standings page will be shown and the standings should be broken into North and South divisions

title: Each division will have a division winner  - should notated according to key
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Rookie
custom_steps:
When the "Pioneer" tab is selected
And a team has clinched a division
custom_expected: Then the division winner[s] will be designated with symbol that is notated in the key at the bottom of the standings page

title: Division winners (4) will be competing playoff teams
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps the Standings from Main Nav
And selects Rookie
custom_steps:
When the "Pioneer" tab is selected
And it is closer to the end of season
custom_expected: Then only the Pioneer League will have 4 division winners

title: Verify when app is in Triple-A mode the correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Triple-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Standings section
And the user should see tabs for: 'International', 'Pacific Coast' leagues.

title: Verify when app is in Double-A mode the correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Standings section
And the user should see tabs for: 'Eastern', 'Southern', 'Texas' leagues.

title: Verify when app is in Class A Advanced mode the correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has tapped the Class A Advanced tab
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Class A Advanced section
And user should see standings for California League, Carolina League and Florida State League only

title: Verify when app is in Class A Full Season mode the correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has tapped the Class A Full Season tab
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Class A Full Season section
And the user should see standings for Midwest League and South Atlantic League only.

title: Verify when app is in Class A Short Season mode the correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has tapped the Class A Short Season tab
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Class A Short Season section
And the user should see standings for New York-Penn League and Northwest League only.

title: Verify when app is in Class Rookie mode the correct standings tabs appear
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section from the slide out menu
And the user taps the Standings cell
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Standings web view
And the user will see standings for Pioneer League and Appalachian League
